intro: Ascarina alticola, commonly known as the mountain satinwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and parks. Ascarina alticola plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various native animals.
